name: French in a Flash: Tapenade Baked Chicken
description: Using tapenade to cook chicken instead of oil coats the roast chicken in a crust of olives, anchovies, garlic, and herbs. You don't have to buy a ton of ingredients or labor for hours to have a Provencal dinner. You just have to coat and roast.
recipeIngredient: 4 teaspoons store-bought or homemade black olive tapenade

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450°F. Wash the chicken, and dry on paper towel. Season with salt, pepper, and herbes de Provence. Rub each piece of chicken, on all sides, with 1 teaspoon tapenade. Place all 4 thighs, skin-side-up, on a foil-lined, rimmed baking sheet. Roast until the inside of the chicken reaches a temperature of 165°F, about 25 minutes.
